message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the winter solstice and its relationship to the length of the day. The winter solstice is the shortest day in the northern hemisphere, meaning that it has the fewest hours of daylight. Option (D) is incorrect because it specifies a specific region, whereas the winter solstice applies to the entire northern hemisphere.
